title: A Salman Khan Dialogue Mention As Air Chief Flags Defence Delivery Delays
content: Chief of Air Staff Air Chief Marshal AP Singh on Thursday flagged serious concerns over inordinate delays in various defence acquisition projects and failure to stick to delivery schedules for supply of key platforms.

title: Extreme Glaciers Could Lose Most Of Their Ice If Global Warming Continues: Study
content: More than twice as much global glacier mass will remain if countries restrict temperature rise to 1.5 degrees Celsius, compared to the warming level of 2.7 degrees Celsius resulting from the current policies, says a new study released.

title: To Revanth Reddy's Rafale Question, BJP's "Miss World Photo Ops" Reply
content: Telangana Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy has triggered a political back-and-forth after questioning Prime Minister Narendra Modi over the handling of the recent conflict with Pakistan.

title: Rain, Thunderstorm Expected In Delhi Today: Weather Office
content: Delhi-NCR is set to witness more rain and stormy weather on Friday, as the India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an orange alert for the region, warning of thunderstorms, lightning, and strong winds reaching speeds of 50-60 km/h.

title: "We Were Ready To Act After Prayers, But India Launched Brahmos": Pak PM
content: The Indian strikes were carried out under Operation Sindoor - a targeted military attack on terror infrastructures in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (PoK) in response to the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Hindu Kush Himalaya Region May Lose 75% Ice By End Of Century: Study
content: The Hindu Kush Himalaya, where glaciers feed rivers supporting two billion people, could lose up to 75 per cent of its ice by the end of the century if global temperatures rise by 2 degrees Celsius, according to a new study.

title: "Disappointed": Shashi Tharoor As Colombia Condemns Deaths In Pak After Op Sindoor
content: Expressing disappointment over Colombia's condolences for the lives lost in Pakistan during Operation Sindoor, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor said there can no equivalence between those who dispatch terrorists and those who defend themselves.

title: In A First, 17 Women Cadets Take Part In NDA's Passing Out Parade
content: The first batch of 17 female cadets graduated from the National Defence Academy (NDA), scripting history by marching along side over 300 male cadets during the Passing Out Parade this morning.

title: "Talks, Terror Cannot Go Together": India On Pakistan PM's "Peace" Call
content: External Affairs Ministry Spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal on Thursday said the only area left for discussion between the two countries is Pakistan's handing over of terrorists and vacating the illegally occupied area of Jammu and Kashmir.

title: "Musk Is Terrific": Trump's Praise As Billionaire Exits US Administration
content: Elon Musk exited the US administration amid widespread protests, thanking Trump for the "opportunity to reduce wasteful spending".

title: "Time Has Come": Moscow Seeks Revival Of Russia-India-China Trilateral
content: Moscow is genuinely interested in the revival of activities within the framework of the Russia-India-China (RIC) format, Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov said on Thursday.

title: Rajasthan Man Who Spent 90 Days In Pak And Sent SIM Cards Arrested: Cops
content: The Delhi Police has arrested a man from Rajasthan for allegedly aiding Pakistani Intelligence Operatives (PIOs) by supplying Indian mobile SIM cards for espionage activities, officials said on Thursday.

title: Trump's Tariffs To Remain In Effect After US Court Grants Stay
content: A federal appeals court on Thursday reinstated the most sweeping of President Donald Trump's tariffs, a day after a trade court had ruled Trump had exceeded his authority in imposing the duties and had ordered an immediate block on them.

title: Won't Tolerate Chinese "Exploitation" Of Universities, Theft Of Research: US
content: The United States will not tolerate "exploitation" of American universities by the Chinese Communist Party or theft of U.S. research and intellectual property, State Department spokesperson Tammy Bruce said on Thursday.

title: "India Always Leads Globally For Peace": Indian Delegation In South Africa
content: An Indian all-party delegation led by NCP-SCP leader Supriya Sule held a joint press conference in Johannesburg, South Africa, during the ongoing diplomatic outreach mission following Operation Sindoor.

title: UN May Cut Nearly 7,000 Jobs Amid Financial Crisis: Report
content: The United Nations Secretariat is preparing to cut its $3.7 billion budget by 20% and slash about 6,900 jobs, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters.

title: At UN, US Says Russia's Putin Should Take Ukraine Ceasefire Deal
content: The United States told the United Nations Security Council on Thursday that its proposal for a ceasefire in Ukraine was "Russia's best possible outcome" and President Vladimir Putin should take the deal.

title: Climate Activist Greta Thunberg To Visit Gaza
content: Climate campaigner Greta Thunberg and other activists will set sail Sunday for Gaza on a humanitarian ship aimed at protesting Israel's war on the territory, a French-Palestinian lawmaker said.

title: "If They Had Told Us Some Years Ago...": Ex Air Chief On Defence Delivery Delay
content: The crucial issue of delay in delivery of homegrown defence equipment and delayed timelines, that was flagged unexpectedly on Thursday by the Chief of Air Staff, Air Chief Marshal Amar Preet Singh, was seconded today by his predecessor.

title: 'Right of self-defence': Tharoor 'disappointed' over Colombia's reaction to Op Sindoor
content: Shashi Tharoor expressed disappointment over Colombia's condolences for lives lost in Pakistan after India's counterstrike, emphasizing India's right to self-defense following the Pahalgam attack. He highlighted the lack of action from Pakistan against terrorists and presented evidence of Pakistani military officials attending terrorist funerals, underscoring Pakistan's complicity in supporting terrorism.

title: 'MIT wants a free Palestine': Indian-American student on Israel 'genocide' in speech
content: During MIT's commencement, Class of 2025 president Megha Vemuri delivered a pro-Palestinian speech, criticizing the university's connections to Israel and urging graduates to take action. Wearing a keffiyeh, she highlighted MIT's research ties with the Israeli military and the destruction of Gaza's educational infrastructure. Vemuri called on graduates to oppose MIT's complicity in what she termed the "ongoing genocide of the Palestinian people."

title: Jodha-Akbar marriage untrue, emperor married Amer palace maid: Rajasthan governor
content: Governor Haribhau Bagde sparked controversy by asserting that Mughal Emperor Akbar married a maid, not a princess from Amer, contradicting historical accounts. He accused British historians of distorting Indian history to diminish native heroes, citing the absence of 'Jodha Bai' in Akbarnama.

title: 'PoK must be given back to India': Salman Khurshid backs Centre's move on Article 370
content: Congress veteran Salman Khurshid, as part of an all-party delegation, lauded the government's decision on Article 370 and the military's response to the Pahalgam attack. He emphasized India's claim to PoK and the necessity of Pakistan ceasing terror activities for any dialogue, including regarding the Indus Waters Treaty. Khurshid also highlighted Indonesia's support for India's stance against Pakistan's narrative.

title: 2 dead, 3 critical after drunk Delhi teen rams speeding car into bicycle, shanty
content: In a tragic incident in Delhi's Janakpuri, a 19-year-old driver, allegedly intoxicated, fatally struck two men and severely injured three others, including a pregnant woman and a child. The accused, Harsh, lost control of his car while returning from a party in Gurgaon, first hitting a bicycle and then crashing into a roadside shanty.

title: Microsoft exec has a message for coders, after it laid off over 2k software engineers
content: Despite recent layoffs impacting software engineers, Microsoft's CPO, Aparna Chennapragada, defends the importance of computer science education. She argues AI is simply another layer of abstraction, transforming roles into "software operators" rather than eliminating them. As Microsoft invests heavily in AI, project managers will also adapt, focusing on editing and refining AI-generated ideas.

title: Bomb threat causes panic at Jaipur family court; premises evacuated
content: A bomb threat led to the evacuation of the Jaipur Family Court on Friday, triggering a rapid response from local police. Authorities promptly evacuated the building as a precautionary measure, ensuring the safety of all individuals present.

title: Who is Anushka's friend in RCB's Qualifier 1 win? Internet wants to know
content: Anushka Sharma's presence at RCB's IPL 2025 Qualifier 1 victory grabbed attention, but the mystery companion beside her sparked online curiosity. The woman is Malvika Nayak, a close friend of Anushka and Business Development head at Innoz Technologies. Malvika's husband, Nikhil Sosale, heads Marketing & Revenue for RCB, solidifying their connection to the team and the celebrity couple.

title: ‘Even if we lose…’: Trump admin readying new strategy to impose tariffs
content: The Donald Trump administration is considering alternative strategies after a court ruling blocked its reciprocal tariffs. Officials are exploring broad-based tariffs under the Trade Act of 1974, allowing levies up to 15% for 150 days. This interim measure would provide time to develop country-specific tariffs, signaling a continued push for trade advantages despite legal challenges.

title: Google cofounder on why he is back to work almost every day after retirement
content: Google co-founder Sergey Brin has returned from retirement to actively contribute to the company's AI development, driven by the transformative potential of generative AI. Brin is deeply involved in training Google's Gemini models, aiming for artificial general intelligence. He considers AI more impactful than previous tech revolutions, focusing on expanding Google's computational capabilities to meet the surging demand.

title: ‘I know electrocution impact’: MP professor contests husband's autopsy report in HC
content: Mamta Pathak, a 60-year-old chemistry professor convicted of her husband's murder and sentenced to 20 years, is challenging the autopsy report in court. She argues that as a chemistry expert, she understands the effects of electrocution on the body and questions the differentiation between electric and thermal burn marks without chemical analysis.

title: 'Musk will always be with us': Trump on 'terrific' Elon's last day, joint press conf later
content: US President Donald Trump on Thursday announced a joint press conference at the White House’s Oval Office for 11 pm (IST) on Friday after Elon Musk stepped down from his role as a special government employee.

title: Virat Kohli: The force behind RCB's dominant march to IPL 2025 final
content: Virat Kohli’s passion and intensity were on full display as he led RCB to the IPL 2025 final. He is no longer the captain but remains the emotional core of the team, driving them forward with relentless energy. With one match to go, fans wonder: will this be the year Kohli finally lifts the IPL trophy he’s longed for?

title: Microsoft CEO to employees in Town Hall: 6000 job cuts were related to…
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella attributed recent layoffs to reorganization rather than performance, impacting even product development roles. The company is aggressively pushing its Copilot AI assistants, securing a significant deal with Barclays for 100,000 licenses. While adoption is growing, some clients are proceeding cautiously, awaiting clearer returns on Microsoft's AI investments.

title: Emotional Virat Kohli hugs teammates, signals 'one more to go!' – Watch
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru secured a dominant eight-wicket victory over Punjab Kings in Qualifier 1, propelling them to their fourth IPL final. Virat Kohli's emotional "one more to go!" message resonated as RCB chased down 102 in 10 overs. They are now one win away from their first IPL title, with Phil Salt's unbeaten 56 leading the charge.

title: Gold price prediction: What's gold rate outlook for May 30 - should you buy or sell?
content: Gold price prediction today: MCX Gold is anticipated to be lower due to overnight COMEX weakness, presenting a sell-on-rise opportunity. Analysts suggest monitoring the ₹96350-96400 resistance zone for potential short entries, with a stop loss at ₹96550. Traders should watch dollar strength, rising Treasury yields, and geopolitical events for risk management.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 flat in opening trade; BSE Sensex dips 100 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened flat in trade on Friday. While Nifty50 was near 24,850, BSE Sensex was down around 100 points in opening trade.

title: Bengaluru road rage: Motorist bites bizman’s finger after car splashes rainwater, flees
content: In Bengaluru, a road rage incident led to severe injury for a businessman after his car unintentionally splashed rainwater on another vehicle. The enraged driver of the other car attacked Jayant Shekhar, biting his finger so severely that it required surgery. Police are now searching for the assailant and his female companion, who also threatened the victim and his family.

title: Why Josh Hazlewood is crucial in RCB’s quest for their maiden IPL title
content: Josh Hazlewood has emerged as a key weapon in RCB’s title charge. With 21 wickets in 11 games, his evolution into a T20 specialist reflects experience, adaptability, and control. Back from injury and peaking at the right time, Hazlewood is the crucial piece in RCB’s quest for their maiden IPL title.

title: Netflix goes down, viewers panic, and the memes take over
content: Netflix experienced a widespread outage, frustrating users across the U.S., Canada, and Asia during peak viewing hours. The error, often linked to cached data issues, prompted a flurry of social media activity as viewers struggled to access their favorite shows. While Netflix remained silent, users turned to humor, creating memes and sharing their experiences on platforms like Twitter/X.

title: Expect thunderstorms, strong winds in Delhi-NCR today; orange alert issued
content: Delhi experienced a slight temperature increase, followed by an overcast sky, gusty winds, and brief rainfall in several areas, offering some relief. The Met Department has issued an orange alert for Friday, forecasting light to moderate rainfall with thunderstorms due to a western disturbance affecting northwest India. Officials advise against mountain travel due to potential severe weather.

title: ‘I’ll make you a star’: Bengaluru dance teacher arrested for sexually harassing teen in car
content: Bharathi Kannan, a 32-year-old dance master, was arrested for allegedly harassing a 17-year-old girl in Bengaluru. He approached her near a bank, promising to make her a celebrity dancer and convinced her to get into his car. Kannan then sexually harassed her during the drive, leading to her desperate attempts to escape and his subsequent arrest under the Pocso Act.

title: Viral: World's lowest ‘banana peel’ car has people scratching their heads
content: Taiwan's automotive scene has birthed the 'Banana Peel,' an ultra-low Honda Civic modification that's turning heads globally. This creation by Stance Garage Taiwan sits millimeters from the ground, achieved through extensive suspension and bodywork alterations. The driver navigates lying down, using cameras.

title: IPL: Mohali high in spirits as Gill returns home after becoming Test captain
content: On Friday, Shubman Gill's Gujarat Titans (GT) will take on Hardik Pandya's Mumbai Indians (MI) in the Eliminator at Punjab cricket's new home, the New PCA Stadium in Mullanpur. It will also be the first time Shubman Gill will play at home after becoming India's Test captain. He has led GT from the front, and winning the IPL will give him the right momentum ahead of the marathon he is expected to have in whites for India.

title: Osmania univ declares April- May UG results for B.Sc, BBA, BA, and B.Com programmes
content: Osmania University has declared the April/May 2025 examination results for various undergraduate courses, including B.Sc (Hons), B.Sc (CBCS), BBA, BA, and B.Com (CBCS). The results are available on the official university portal. The institution, recently accredited with an 'A' grade by NAAC, continues to maintain high academic standards. The Vice-Chancellor congratulated the successful students and encouraged others to improve. These results mark an important milestone in the academic careers of thousands of students.

title: Day after being struck down, US appeals court allows Trump tariffs to stay in effect
content: Donald Trump received temporary approval to continue collecting tariffs under emergency powers, following a federal trade court ruling that deemed his sweeping levies on foreign imports unlawful. The US Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit has paused the trade court's decision while the White House appeals.

title: 'Water is our red line': Pak army chief Asim Munir
content: Pakistan's Army chief, General Asim Munir, has asserted that the Indus Water Treaty is a non-negotiable red line for the nation, emphasizing that no compromise will be entertained regarding water rights for Pakistan's population. This declaration follows India's suspension of the treaty after the Pahalgam terrorist attack, escalating tensions between the two countries.

title: Panchkula family tragedy: 3 days after mass suicide, police await handwriting samples
content: In the Panchkula mass suicide case, police are awaiting Praveen Mittal's handwriting samples to authenticate the suicide note, crucial for ruling out foul play. Investigators have requested handwriting samples from Mittal's bank, but the bank is yet to provide the necessary documents, delaying the forensic analysis.

title: 'Gravity stinks': Sunita Williams & Wilmore reflect on microgravity's aftermath
content: NASA astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore faced an extended stay of 256 days on the ISS due to Starliner's technical issues. Upon returning to Earth in March 2025, they underwent intensive rehabilitation to readjust to gravity. Wilmore humorously noted the initial discomfort, while Williams described fatigue and muscle re-engagement.

title: Karnataka govt mulls sending Muslim quota bill to President
content: Karnataka's Congress government is contemplating sending the Karnataka Transparency in Public Procurement (Amendment) Bill, 2025, to the President after the governor rejected it twice. The bill proposes 4% reservation for Muslims in civil contracts up to Rs 1 crore, alongside quotas for other categories. The government is exploring options after constitutional experts advised against challenging the governor's decision in court.

title: Signs and symptoms of Heart failure that are easy to ignore at first
content: One of the earliest signs of heart failure is feeling unusually tired or weak, even during simple daily activities like climbing stairs, shopping, or walking short distances. This happens because the heart is not pumping enough oxygen-rich blood to the muscles and organs, leading to a constant feeling of exhaustion. People often dismiss this fatigue as just getting older or being out of shape, but it can be a warning sign of heart failure

title: I’ve become more famous: Pahalgam attack plotter in Pakistan
content: Lashkar-e-Taiba commander Saifullah Kasuri, a key plotter in the Pahalgam terror attack, delivered an inflammatory anti-India speech in Lahore, surrounded by Pakistani security forces and ISI officials. He boasted about his notoriety following the attack, sharing the stage with US-designated terrorist Talha Saeed. "I have become more famous since being accused of the attack," he gloated, as per information reaching here.

title: 7 BSF women defended 2 posts for 3 days & nights during Sindoor
content: In a historic moment, young BSF women personnel, led by Assistant Commandant Neha Bhandari, fiercely defended forward posts in J&K's Akhnoor sector during Operation Sindoor. They engaged Pakistani forces with heavy retaliatory fire for three days, compelling them to retreat. This marked a significant instance of women in active combat roles, showcasing their capabilities on par with their male counterparts.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for May 30, 2025
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research suggests a resilient Indian equity market, projecting Nifty consolidation between 24,400-25,200 with a bullish outlook supported by rate cut expectations and favorable monsoon forecasts. Aurobindo Pharma and Gokaldas Exports are highlighted as top stock picks, indicating potential upward movement.

title: RCB's pack of wolves leave PBKS battered in their own backyard
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru's dominant bowling attack dismantled Punjab Kings in Qualifier 1, restricting them to a mere 101 runs. RCB's bowlers, including Hazlewood and Sharma, wreaked havoc, while Punjab's batting crumbled with soft dismissals and rash shots. Salt's explosive innings propelled RCB to a comfortable victory, securing their spot in the IPL 2025 final.

title: RBI looks to shield forex kitty as geopolitical tensions rise
content: The RBI is fortifying its forex reserves against weaponization by diversifying assets across currencies and jurisdictions, reducing reliance on the US dollar. With reserves constituting 74% of its Rs 76 lakh crore balance sheet, the central bank aims to insulate the Indian economy from external shocks. Simultaneously, the RBI promotes rupee-denominated trade and enhances data security with the upcoming IFS Cloud.

title: Mass resignations in Cong minority unit in Mangaluru over 'revenge killings'
content: In Dakshina Kannada, several Muslim Congress functionaries resigned, citing government negligence and failure to protect the community following revenge killings, including the murder of a mosque secretary.

title: India won tech war, Pak lost as China's proxy: US expert
content: Operation Sindoor showcased India's military triumph over Pakistan and a technological edge over China. India's indigenously developed weapons, born from 'Make in India' and 'Atmanirbhar Bharat,' outperformed Chinese-supplied platforms used by Pakistan. This victory highlighted the success of India's self-reliance push in defense, contrasting with Pakistan's reliance on less effective Chinese hardware.

title: Remanded till June 2, Nagpur woman vows Pak return after release
content: Sunita Jamgade, a former nurse, was arrested in Nagpur for suspected espionage after crossing the LoC and entering POK. She disappeared on May 14, leaving her son in Kargil, and was handed over to Indian authorities by Pakistan Rangers after nine days.

title: Russell Wilson says he manifested Ciara before their relationship even started
content: Russell Wilson shared personal insights on the 7PM in Brooklyn podcast, detailing his NFL journey and move to the New York Giants. He revealed the pivotal role of faith in his life, particularly the prayer that led him to Ciara. Wilson emphasized the importance of shared values and mutual respect in their relationship, highlighting Ciara's independence and strong identity.

title: Magic Johnson apologises to OKC after Thunder's 30-point Game 5 win
content: The Oklahoma City Thunder are heading to the NBA Finals for the first time since 2012 after defeating the Minnesota Timberwolves. Magic Johnson apologized for underestimating the Thunder, praising GM Sam Presti for building an amazing roster. Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, named Western Conference Finals MVP, led the charge with stellar performances.

title: 'Tied to suicide case', Maharashtra special IG relieved of additional charge
content: Following allegations of shielding accused individuals in the Vaishnavi Hagawane suicide case, the Maharashtra home department has relieved IPS officer Jalindar Supekar of his additional charge as DIG of prisons for Nashik, Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar, and Nagpur divisions. The decision was made considering the importance and responsibilities associated with the DIG post.

title: Submit inquiry file on security of Michel, Delhi court tells Tihar jail
content: A Delhi court has directed Tihar jail authorities to present the inquiry file concerning the security of Christian Michel James, who is jailed in connection with the AgustaWestland case. Special Judge Sanjeev Aggarwal has set June 6 as the deadline for the submission.

title: ‘Bhool Chuk Maaf’ Box Office collection: Film mints Rs 44 crore in 1st week
content: Rajkummar Rao and Wamiqa Gabbi's 'Bhool Chuk Maaf' is captivating audiences, earning over Rs. 44 crore in its first week. Released on May 23, 2025, the film's blend of humor and emotion resonated strongly, particularly with family audiences. Despite initial delays, the movie's success is driven by positive word-of-mouth and a compelling storyline set in Banaras.

title: CM Stalin orders establishment of four more arts and science colleges in Tamil Nadu
content: On May 26, Mr. Stalin, via video conference from the Secretariat in Chennai, inaugurated new State-run arts and science colleges at 11 locations

title: Southwest monsoon rainfall continues to lash Kerala
content: Three districts – Kasaragod, Kannur and Idukki – are on red alert, while the 11 remaining districts are on orange alert

title: Heavy rains batter Kerala overnight, cause widespread havoc and power outages
content: IMD says severe weather set to continue with low-pressure area over Bay of Bengal intensifying. It has issued a red alert for Idukki, Kannur and Kasaragod districts

title: First batch of 17 women cadets graduates from NDA alongside over 300 male peers
content: “These young women are the inevitable symbol of “Naari Shakti”, embodying not just women’s development but women-led development,” Gen. V.K. Singh said

title: IRCTC case: Court reserves order on framing of charges against Lalu Prasad, Rabri Devi, Tejashwi
content: The charges include criminal conspiracy, cheating and corruption that carry a maximum jail term of seven years.

title: PM Modi to inaugurate, lay foundation stone of development projects worth ₹48,520 crore in Bihar
content: The Prime Minister, who arrived in Patna on a two-day visit to the State on Thursday (May 29, 2025), will also address a public rally in Karakat.

title: In images: Rain damage in Mangaluru, Dakshina Kannada
content: Some areas in Mangaluru city, like Jeppinamogaru, Rao and Rao Circle, Mission Street and Kopparahitlu, were flooded and there were reports of trees falling.

title: Shashi Tharoor ‘disappointed’ that Colombia expressed sympathies with Pakistan during Operation Sindoor
content: The Congress MP, who is leading a multiparty delegation to Colombia, stated on Thursday (May 29, 2025) that India was only exercising its right to self-defence.

title: Maharashtra received 40 percent of the country’s FDI, says Fadnavis
content: Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis claimed that in the financial year 2024-25, Maharashtra witnessed a record foreign direct investment and 40 percent of the total investment in the country this year has been made in Maharashtra alone.

title: The modern short story in a regional language and the function of translations
content: Translators of three recent anthologies in The Early Classic Stories Series by HarperCollins discuss challenges and technique

title: 'Spent 90 days in Pakistan, met ISI officials': Delhi Police arrests Rajasthan man for espionage
content: Using social media on these Indian SIMs, PIOs contacted Indians to extract classified information pertaining to sensitive installations and departments

title: Model zero-cost MRFs in Dakshina Kannada process dry waste generated by 223 gram panchayats
content: As part of Swachh Bharath Mission, the Central government mooted the setting up of a material recovery facility with the capacity of handling 10 tonnes of waste per day in a few places, including in Dakshina Kannada

title: On Andhra’s verdant hills, diseases hunt
content: As monsoon clouds gather over the picturesque hills of ASR district, tribespeople cross their fingers, for in their hamlets, where even paracetamol is hard to come by, seasonal illnesses can kill. B Madhu Gopal finds out how systemic problems turn an entire people into easy prey for ailments long conquered in other parts of the State

title: Autonomous warfare in Operation Sindoor
content: In the recent India-Pakistan war, over four days of hostilities, both sides effectively rewrote their rules of engagement, ushering in a ‘new normal’ of airborne deterrence without pilots, but with autonomous platforms, armed drones and loitering munitions

title: Rains LIVE: Heavy rains batter Kerala overnight, two die in landslips in Dakshina Kannada
content: Heavy rain accompanied by gusty wind forced at least 1,200 citizens to seek refuge in government-run relief camps in Kerala

title: Ration distribution to begin from June 1 across State: Minister
content: Fair price shops will remain open every day, including Sundays, from June 1 to 15; if market prices rise, we will supply essential items at subsidised rates through these shops, says Mr. Manohar

title: Hyderabad Gulzar Houz fire tragedy: Smoke, sorrow and a system on fire
content: Two weeks ago, a fierce blaze tore through a century-old Hyderabad home near Charminar, claiming 17 of a family, including eight children. Even as grieving relatives point the finger at a slow, ill-equipped emergency response, the tragedy has also exposed how aging neighbourhoods with cramped homes, blocked exits and faulty wiring can turn a single short circuit into a catastrophe. Naveen Kumar and Lavpreet Kaur uncover the gaps in safety and emergency readiness

title: India virtually rejects Washington's claim of offering trade to halt Indo-Pak conflict
content: India has been consistently maintaining that the understanding on cessation of hostilities with Pakistan was reached following direct talks between the Directors General of Military Operations (DGMOs) of the two militaries

title: Taking baby steps to regulate pre-schools in Karnataka
content: The Department of School Education and Literacy in Karnataka, earlier this week, issued an order making registration mandatory for all newly started pre-schools. But stakeholders say tell Jayanth R. that more needs to be done to regulate pre-schools in the interest of children’s education and safety

title: 76 new COVID-19 cases come to light in Maharashtra
content: There are 425 active patients at present while 165 patients have recovered. Seven patients have died since January, of which six were suffering from co-morbidities

title: No need for concern over COVID cases, says Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan
content: State has 727 active cases and govt. has put in place requisite testing and trearment facilities, says Pinarayi

title: Delimitation: 129 new wards in grama panchayats in Ernakulam
content: A total of 1,990 wards have been formed in the district across 82 grama panchayats, 13 municipalities, and the Kochi Corporation. Of them, 147 are new wards

title: Pakistan only a cradle of terrorism, has nothing good to offer: Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that Pakistan should understand that we have entered their house and hit them three times

title: West Bengal’s role is critical to vision of a developed India, says PM
content: The PM said the City Gas Distribution network was an example of doorstep delivery  of schemes; clean and affordable energy will be supplied to households via a pipeline

title: Aspirational Nuh district in Haryana, abandoned education
content: Haryana’s Nuh district ranks the lowest in the State board examination results, which were released earlier in May. With a 45% dropout rate after Class 10, officials blame cheating, teachers cite staff shortage, and parents question the value of education amid poor employment opportunities in the State, Samridhi Tewari reports

title: BSF fortifies village guards initiative with arms training for Jammu border residents
content: In one of the largest deployments in recent times, more than 52,000 Central forces to be posted for Amarnath Yatra security; this is likely the first time the BSF has been engaged to provide training to village defence guards; earlier provided with .303 rifles, the guards are being provided with semi-automatic guns

title: The case for a special fiscal package for Andhra Pradesh
content: It is for the Finance Commission to come up with an apolitical and formula-based solution so that States that have lost fiscal capacity are not abandoned

title: ED official arrested for accepting ₹20 lakh bribe in Bhubaneswar
content: The Deputy Director-level officer had reportedly struck a ₹50 lakh deal with a Bhubaneswar-based mine operator

title: National Highway 66 at Malappuram: A hype comes crashing down
content: The collapse of the newly built National Highway 66 at Malappuram and the deep fissures that were developed on the road stretches in Thrissur, Kozhikode and Kannur districts have caught the State and the Union governments off guard. As questions are being raised about public safety and the technical feasibility of the ambitious road projects in the State, Abdul Latheef Naha hits the road to weigh up the situation

title: Courts cannot remain mute spectators, Karnataka HC says in order to ban Proton Mail over digital sexual abuse
content: One month after pronouncing order, HC releases full judgement; Swiss-based encrypted mail platform still accessible in India; Proton had refused to help lawyers identify users who sent obscene emails to a woman

title: 4 kgs ganja seized, seven peddlers arrested
content: With ongoing investigations, more arrests are likely to take place, says Krishna district Superintendent of Police R. Gangadhar Rao

title: New rail lines in M.P. will boost freight movement and tourism, says Railways Minister
content: ₹1,018 crore project to ease congestion on high-density route; new trains and station upgrades announced for Madhya Pradesh

title: Two marsh crocodiles born in Thiruvananthapuram zoo
content: Zoo veterinary surgeon Nikesh Kiran examined the newborn muggers and shifted them to a specially created pond.

title: Election Commission’s one-point dashboard to become operational before Bihar election
content: Named ‘ECINET’, it is aimed at providing all services for stakeholders at a single point, instead of the over 40 apps or websites that exist now

title: Heavy rain continues to pound Ernakulam
content: Three houses fully damaged— one each in Kanayannur, Kochi and Kothamangalam taluks; waterlogging hits usual trouble spots within Corporation limits; bylanes in Thoppumpady, Palluruthy, Kannamaly, and Edakochi reported flooding

title: Amit Shah arrives in J&K to review security situation, plans for Amarnath Yatra
content: Union Home Minister will meet border residents affected by Pakistan shelling; parties hopeful of financial package

title: Murmu inaugurates two-day literary conference
content: The conference will deliberate on topics such as ‘Feminist Literature of India: Breaking New Grounds’; ‘Change in Literature vs Literature of Change’; and ‘New Directions of Indian Literature in Global Perspective’

title: MiTran Global to hold two-day online camp for teenagers to impart positivity
content: Final summer edition designed to equip young minds with focused learning strategies through modules on memory techniques and growth mindset; workbook and certificate included.

title: Tamil Nadu government constitutes Seventh State Finance Commission
content: It will review the financial position of various urban and rural local bodies and make appropriate recommendations on the distribution of funds to be provided by the State government

title: Bengal’s protesting teachers ‘ignored by PM and CM’ as one dies of ‘stress’

title: Knicks stay alive, throttle Pacers to force Game 6

title: Stars' DeBoer defends call to pull Oettinger early

content: Chris Sale's 2,500th strikeout came in his 2,026th inning, the fastest time frame in which a pitcher has reached that mark.
